experiment_info.name: condition_number_init
experiment_info.description: Weight sensors by condition number contribution for initialization
experiment_info.hypothesis: Weighting sensors by information content may improve initialization

reason_aborted: INITIALIZATION AND SENSOR WEIGHTING FAMILIES EXHAUSTED. (1) physics_informed_init: FAILED - 'The initialization family should be marked as EXHAUSTED'. (2) weighted_sensor_loss: FAILED - 'Optimization Target Mismatch: optimum of weighted loss differs from unweighted RMSE'. (3) informative_sensor_subset: FAILED - 'Selecting sensors HURTS accuracy vs all sensors'. (4) Current triangulation+hotspot init is already optimal.

physics_informed_init.finding: The initialization family should be marked as EXHAUSTED

weighted_sensor_loss.finding: Optimization Target Mismatch: optimum of weighted loss differs from unweighted RMSE

informative_sensor_subset.finding: Selecting sensors HURTS accuracy vs using all sensors

more_inits_select_best.finding: The baseline 2-init strategy (triangulation + hotspot) is already optimal

key_insight: Sensor weighting was tested in multiple contexts and always failed. The key issue: the scoring formula uses UNWEIGHTED RMSE across all sensors. Any weighting scheme optimizes for a DIFFERENT objective than what we're scored on. Additionally, initialization has been thoroughly explored with no improvements found.
